noun.description: A member of an American Indian people of northern Oaxaca in southern Mexico.
The Oto-Manguean language spoken by this people.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Mazatecs or their language.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Augustus Henry Keane (1833–1912). From Spanish Mazateca from Nahuatl masa:te:ka from masa deer + -te:ka ending denoting inhabitant of the place of —.
